security_audit.summary: All static findings evaluated as false positives. The skill contains standard API development documentation with shell scripting examples that are legitimate DevOps practices. Environment variable references and example URLs are standard configuration patterns for production API workflows.

content.user_title: Build production-ready REST APIs with TDD
content.value_statement: Building APIs requires systematic planning, implementation, testing, and deployment. This skill orchestrates 12 specialist agents across 5 phases to deliver production-ready REST APIs using Test-Driven Development methodology.
actual_capabilities: Orchestrates 12 specialist agents (product-manager, system-architect, backend-developer, security-specialist, and more) across 5 development phases
Implements complete Test-Driven Development workflow with Red-Green-Refactor cycles for each endpoint
Creates comprehensive test suite with greater than 90% code coverage targets
Executes blue-green deployment strategy with validation gates and automatic rollback
Generates complete API documentation including OpenAPI specs, developer guides, and operations runbooks
limitations: Does not generate mobile or frontend client code
Does not provision actual cloud infrastructure or cloud accounts
Does not perform legal or compliance audits beyond security testing
Requires existing Claude Flow tooling for multi-agent coordination

use_cases.title: Enterprise API Development Team
use_cases.description: Systematic API development with quality gates, comprehensive testing, and production deployment for teams building mission-critical backend services.
use_cases.target_user: Development teams building production APIs requiring security, performance, and reliability validation

use_cases.title: Startup MVP Development
use_cases.description: Rapid API scaffolding with TDD practices, CI/CD setup, and deployment automation for startups needing production-ready APIs in 2 weeks.
use_cases.target_user: Startups and small teams needing rapid, quality-focused API development

use_cases.title: Microservices Migration
use_cases.description: Modernizing legacy APIs with comprehensive testing, documentation, and blue-green deployment strategies for safe production rollout.
use_cases.target_user: Teams migrating or modernizing existing API architectures

prompt_templates.title: Basic API Development
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a production-ready REST API for [API_NAME] with [NUMBER] endpoints covering [ENDPOINT_TYPES]. Use this skill to orchestrate the full development workflow from requirements through deployment with TDD methodology.
prompt_templates.scenario: Starting a new API project from scratch with standard requirements

prompt_templates.title: API with Security Requirements
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a secure REST API for [DOMAIN] with PCI-DSS compliance requirements. Use this skill with enhanced security-specialist involvement, OWASP validation, and penetration testing in Phase 4.
prompt_templates.scenario: Building APIs with strict security and compliance requirements

prompt_templates.title: Legacy API Migration
prompt_templates.prompt: Migrate the existing [LEGACY_API_NAME] to a modern REST architecture. Use this skill to create comprehensive tests, documentation, and deploy with blue-green strategy for zero-downtime transition.
prompt_templates.scenario: Migrating or modernizing existing API implementations

prompt_templates.title: Microservices with Event-Driven Architecture
prompt_templates.prompt: Build an event-driven microservices API for [DOMAIN] with message queue integration. Use this skill to coordinate synchronous REST endpoints and asynchronous event handlers with pub/sub patterns.
prompt_templates.scenario: Building APIs with asynchronous event processing and message queues

output: Phase 1 Planning Complete: 8 endpoints defined, OpenAPI 3.0 spec generated, PostgreSQL schema designed, test strategy created with 95% coverage target
Phase 2 Foundation: Node.js/Express project initialized with TypeScript, ESLint, Prettier, Jest, Prisma ORM, Winston logging
Phase 3 TDD Implementation: 8 endpoints completed with 96% coverage, all tests passing, code reviewed and refactored
Phase 4 Testing: E2E tests passing, load testing at 1500 req/sec, security audit passed (zero high issues), documentation published
Phase 5 Deployment: Blue-green deployment successful, monitoring active, documentation published to developer portal

output_examples.input: Build a payment gateway API with PCI compliance
output: Security Architecture: PCI-DSS compliant design with tokenization, encrypted sensitive data handling, audit logging
TDD Implementation: All endpoints implemented with security-focused test cases, 94% coverage
Security Testing: OWASP Top 10 validation, penetration testing, SAST/DAST scanning passed
Production Deployment: Zero-downtime blue-green deployment with automatic rollback on error rate exceeding 1%

best_practices: Follow the TDD Red-Green-Refactor cycle strictly for every endpoint to maintain test coverage
Validate production readiness with all quality gates before deployment
Use blue-green deployment strategy to minimize risk and enable instant rollback
anti_patterns: Skipping test creation or reducing coverage targets below 90%
Bypassing security review for endpoints handling sensitive data
Ignoring Phase 4 validation results to meet deadline

faq.question: What programming languages and frameworks does this skill support?
faq.answer: The skill is framework-agnostic. Example implementations use Node.js/Express, but the methodology applies to FastAPI (Python), Spring Boot (Java), or any REST framework.

faq.question: How long does a complete API development cycle take?
faq.answer: The default timeline is 14 days across 5 phases. Simple APIs can complete in 7-10 days, while complex APIs with security requirements may take 3-4 weeks.

faq.question: Does this skill work for GraphQL APIs?
faq.answer: The core TDD and multi-agent methodology applies to GraphQL. You would adapt the endpoint testing patterns to GraphQL queries and mutations.

faq.question: What test coverage targets should I set?
faq.answer: The skill targets greater than 90% coverage for new code. Higher coverage may be required for security-critical or financial APIs.

faq.question: Can I customize the number of agents or phases?
faq.answer: Yes, the swarm initialization supports adjusting agent count and topology. Phase structure can be simplified for smaller projects.

faq.question: What deployment environments are supported?
faq.answer: The skill supports Kubernetes/Docker deployments, traditional servers, and serverless platforms. Blue-green strategy works best with container orchestration.
